note_text:
Indications: Left upper lobe mass 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Medications: General Anesthesia,
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention.
Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway was in good position. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first subsegmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy were normal; there are no endobronchial lesions. We then removed the diagnostic Q190 bronchoscopy and the super-dimension navigational catheter was inserted through the T190 therapeutic bronchoscope and advanced into the airway. Using navigational map we attempted to advance the 90 degree edge catheter into the proximity of the lesion within the left upper lobe. Confirmation of placement once at the point of interest with radial ultrasound showed a concentric view within the lesion. Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle, brush, triple needle brush and forceps, under fluoroscopic visualization.  After adequate samples were obtained the bronchoscope was removed and the procedure completed
Complications: No immediate complications
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 5 cc.
Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Flexible bronchoscopy with successful navigational biopsy of left upper lobe nodule.  
- Await final pathology

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal vocal cords, subglottic space, trachea, and carina. Normal bronchial mucosa/anatomy to subsegmental level.

navigation_targets.notes: 90 degree edge catheter used. Triple needle brush mentioned.

outcomes.preliminary_diagnosis: Successful navigational biopsy of LUL nodule

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s)
Bronchoscopy with brushing or protected brushings

lines.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s)
lines.selection_reason: Primary therapeutic code (highest RVU). Supported by needle aspiration of LUL mass.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy with brushing or protected brushings
lines.selection_reason: Distinct modality (brushing) performed. Subject to multiple endoscopy reduction.
Navigation system used to guide catheter to target.
Radial EBUS used to confirm concentric view of peripheral lesion.
Bundled with 31629 when performed on the same lesion/site (LUL mass) per NCCI. 31629 selected as higher value.

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Multiple Endoscopy Rule: 31629 (100%). 31623 (Pay difference vs base 31622). Since 31623 allowance (135) < base 31622 (136), increment is 0. Add-ons paid 100%.

per_code.summary: Primary code for needle aspiration of LUL mass.
Secondary code for brushing of LUL mass.
Add-on for navigation planning and guidance.

global_comments: Forceps biopsy (31628) dropped in favor of 31629 (Needle) as both targeted the same LUL lesion; NCCI bundles biopsies of the same site.

note_text:
Indications: Left upper lobe mass 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the preprocedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the anesthesia record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea is of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. All left and right sided airways were normal without endobronchial disease. The video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. A systematic hilar and mediastinal lymph node survey was carried out. Sampling criteria (5mm short axis diameter) were met in station 11Ri (5.0 mm), and 11Rs(6.6 mm). Additionally the 4L was 4.9 mm but slightly hypoechoic and decision was made to sample this node as well. Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed in these lymph nodes using an Olympus Visioshot 2 EBUSTBNA 21 gauge needle. All samples were sent for routine cytology. We then removed the EBUS bronchoscopy and the super-dimension navigational catheter was inserted through the therapeutic bronchoscope and advanced into the airway. Using navigational map we advanced the 180  degree edge catheter into the proximity of the lesion within the left upper lobe. Confirmation of placement once at the point of interest with radial ultrasound showed a concentric view. Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle, triple needle brush and forceps, under fluoroscopic visualization. After adequate samples were obtained the bronchoscope was removed. Fluoroscopic inspection was performed and no pneumothorax was visualized at the conclusion of the procedure. 

Complications: No immediate complications
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 5 cc.
Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Flexible bronchoscopy with successful and biopsy of left upper nodule
- Negative Staging EBUS on preliminary evaluation 
- Await final pathology  
- Post-procedure xray did not show pneumothorax. 
- Patient was noted to be slightly hypoxic post-procedure likely as a result of sedation and decision was made to admit patient for overnight observation.

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal vocal cords, subglottic space, trachea, carina. Normal airways.

complications.other_complication_details: Slightly hypoxic post-procedure, admitted for observation.

outcomes.preliminary_diagnosis: Left upper nodule, Negative Staging EBUS

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe

lines.selection_reason: EBUS-TBNA of 2 stations (11R, 4L).
TBLB of LUL mass (distinct lesion from lymph nodes). Modifier XS suggested.
Navigation used for LUL mass.
Radial EBUS used for LUL mass.

per_code.summary: Biopsy of LUL mass. Primary biopsy code for the peripheral lesion.

global_comments: Peripheral TBNA (31629) and Brushing (31623) on the LUL mass are bundled into the TBLB (31628) or EBUS codes.

note_text:
Indications: Left upper lobe mass 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the preprocedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the anesthesia record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea is of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. All left and right sided airways were normal without endobronchial disease. Endobronchial brushing was performed at the takeoff of the right upper lobe followed by endobronchial biopsies within the right upper, right middle and left upper lobe for research purposes as per standard DECAMP protocol.  The video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. A systematic hilar and mediastinal lymph node survey was carried out. Sampling criteria (5mm short axis diameter) were met in station 11Rs and station 711L lymph nodes.  Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed in these lymph nodes using an Olympus EBUSTBNA 22 gauge needle. Further details regarding nodal size and number of samples are included in the attached EBUS procedural sheet. All samples were sent for routine cytology. We then removed the EBUS bronchoscopy and the super-dimension navigational catheter was inserted through the therapeutic bronchoscope and advanced into the airway. Using navigational map we attempted to advance the 45 degree edge catheter into the proximity of the lesion within the left upper lobe. Confirmation of placement once at the point of interest with radial ultrasound failed to confirm location on multiple attempts and we subsequently removed the ENB catheter and were able to locate the lesion based on anatomical knowledge with the white light bronchoscope and confirm target with radial EBUS. Biopsies were then performed with a variety of instruments to include peripheral needle and forceps, under fluoroscopic visualization followed by BAL of the segment.  ROSE showed malignancy within the target lesion in the left upper lobe.  After adequate samples were obtained the bronchoscope was removed. Fluoroscopic inspection was performed and no pneumothorax was visualized at the conclusion of the procedure. 

Complications: No immediate complications
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 5 cc.
Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Flexible bronchoscopy with successful and biopsy of left upper lobe mass with malignancy identified on primary evaluation. 
- Negative Staging EBUS on preliminary evaluation 
- Await final pathology

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Vocal cords normal, subglottic space normal, trachea normal caliber, carina sharp. Left and right airways normal.

outcomes.preliminary_diagnosis: Left upper lobe mass with malignancy identified on primary evaluation

navigation_targets.notes: Navigation attempted but failed to confirm location. Lesion located via white light + radial EBUS.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 3 or more nodal stations
Bronchoscopy; with transbronchial lung biopsy(s), single lobe
Bronchoscopy; with bronchial or endobronchial biopsy(s)
EBUS for peripheral lesion(s) during bronchoscopic intervention(s) (add-on)

lines.selection_reason: EBUS-TBNA on 3 stations (11R, 7, 11L).
TBLB of LUL mass.
Endobronchial biopsies RUL/RML/LUL (research).
BAL LUL segment.
Navigation initiated and attempted.
Radial EBUS used for target confirmation.

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: MER: 31653 (100%). Secondaries paid difference vs base (136). 31628(+43), 31625(+24), 31624(+1). Add-ons 100%.

metadata.notes: Assumption made regarding 'station 711L' typo being '7 and 11L' or '7, 11L'. Navigation code included despite failure to confirm target via ENB, as system was set up and advancement attempted.

note_text:
Indications: Left upper lobe nodule 
Medications: Propofol infusion via anesthesia assistance  
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the preprocedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention. 
Following intravenous medications as per the anesthesia record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea is of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. All left and right sided airways were normal without endobronchial disease. The video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. A systematic hilar and mediastinal lymph node survey was carried out. Sampling criteria (5mm short axis diameter) were met in station 7 and 11L. Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed in these lymph nodes using an Olympus Visioshot  EBUSTBNA 19 gauge needle. All samples were sent for routine cytology. We then tried to visualize the FDG avid station 5 lymph node seen on PET CT through the pulmonary artery but were unable to clearly visualize the node and thus could not sample from the mainstem approach (transvascular). We then removed the EBUS bronchoscopy. At this point the patient had lost her IV access and developed laryngospasm prompting us to bronchoscopically intubate the patient with a size 8.5 ETT which was easily passed through the vocal cords and into the lower trachea before being secured in place. The Q190 bronchscope was then advanced, using anatomical knowledge,  into the proximal left upper lobe adjacent to the station 5 lymph node and utilizing radial EBUS attempted to sample this node through an airway approach with a transbronchial needle approach. ROSE was unrevealing and we subsequently the super-dimension navigational catheter was inserted through the therapeutic bronchoscope and advanced into the airway. Using navigational map we advanced the 180 degree edge catheter into the proximity of the lesion within the left upper lobe. Confirmation of placement was attempted once we were in the vicinity of the point of interest with radial ultrasound. The lesion however could not be adequately visualized. Multiple attempts to navigate to the lesion were unfruitful and we subsequently completed the procedure without attempting to sample the left upper lobe peripheral lesion. 
Complications: No immediate complications
Estimated Blood Loss: Less than 5 cc.
Post Procedure Diagnosis:
- Negative Staging EBUS on preliminary evaluation 
- Flexible bronchoscopy with unsuccessful electromagnetic navigation to the left upper nodule
- Await final pathology  
- Discharge once post-op criteria met

clinical_context.radiographic_findings: FDG avid station 5 lymph node seen on PET CT

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Normal vocal cords, subglottic space, trachea, carina, and bilateral airways.

navigation_targets.notes: Lesion could not be adequately visualized with radial US; procedure completed without sampling LUL lesion.

specimens_collected.notes: Attempted via airway approach using radial EBUS guidance after transvascular EBUS approach failed.

complications.other_complication_details: Patient lost IV access and developed laryngospasm requiring emergent bronchoscopic intubation.

outcomes.procedure_aborted_reason: Unable to navigate/visualize LUL target; Station 5 sampled but LUL lesion not sampled.
outcomes.preliminary_diagnosis: Negative Staging EBUS; Unsuccessful navigation to LUL nodule

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy with transbronchial needle aspiration biopsy(s) (Station 5)

lines.selection_reason: Linear EBUS sampling of Stations 7 and 11L (2 stations).
Conventional/Radial TBNA of Station 5 (distinct from linear EBUS). Modifier XS.
Navigation initiated and catheter advanced to target proximity, though visualization failed.

per_code.summary: TBNA of Station 5 via conventional/radial approach. Distinct from linear EBUS sites.

global_comments: Radial EBUS (+31654) omitted as peripheral lesion not visualized and Station 5 is central.

note_text:
Indications: lung cancer diagnosis and staging (left upper lobe tumor)
Medications: General Anesthesia
Procedure, risks, benefits, and alternatives were explained to the patient. All questions were answered and informed consent was documented as per institutional protocol. A history and physical were performed and updated in the pre-procedure assessment record. Laboratory studies and radiographs were reviewed. A time-out was performed prior to the intervention.
 Following intravenous medications as per the record and topical anesthesia to the upper airway and tracheobronchial tree, the Q190 video bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. The laryngeal mask airway was in good position. The vocal cords appeared normal. The subglottic space was normal. The trachea was of normal caliber. The carina was sharp. The tracheobronchial tree was examined to at least the first sub-segmental level. Bronchial mucosa and anatomy were normal; there are no endobronchial lesions, except for in the left lower lobe in which the proximal origin was mildly extrinsically compressed.  The video bronchoscope was then removed and the UC180F convex probe EBUS bronchoscope was introduced through the mouth, via laryngeal mask airway and advanced to the tracheobronchial tree. A systematic hilar and mediastinal lymph node survey was carried out. Sampling criteria (5mm short axis diameter) were met in station 11Rs (6.7mm), 10R (5.7mm), 4R (9.1mm), 2R (7.1 mm), 7 (15.7mm), 4L (6.9mm),  and 11L (21.1mm)  lymph nodes.  Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed beginning with the 11Rs Lymph node followed by 7, and 4R, 2R lymph nodes using an Olympus EBUSTBNA 22 gauge needle. ROSE showed malignant cells in the 4R and 2R station consistent with N3 disease. We then moved to the large 11L lymph node and took 8 additional passes for molecular studies. All samples were sent for routine cytology and a dedicated pass from the 11L was sent for flow cytometry. The Q190 video bronchoscope was then re-inserted and after suctioning blood and secretions there was no evidence of active bleeding and the bronchoscope was subsequently removed.

Complications: No immediate complications
Estimated Blood Loss: 5 cc.

Post Procedure Recommendations:
- Transfer to post-procedure unit and home per protocol
- Will await final pathology results

clinical_context.primary_indication: Lung cancer diagnosis and staging (left upper lobe tumor)

diagnostic_bronchoscopy.inspection_findings: Vocal cords normal, subglottic space normal, trachea normal caliber, carina sharp. LLL proximal origin mildly extrinsically compressed. No endobronchial lesions.

outcomes.follow_up_plan_text: Transfer to post-procedure unit and home per protocol. Await final pathology.

linear_ebus_stations_detail.notes: Large lymph node, 8 additional passes taken for molecular studies.

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with EBUS sampling, 3 or more nodal stations
lines.selection_reason: Linear EBUS-TBNA performed on 5 distinct stations (11R, 7, 4R, 2R, 11L), meeting the 3+ station criteria.

note_spans.snippet: Sampling by transbronchial needle aspiration was performed beginning with the 11Rs Lymph node followed by 7, and 4R, 2R lymph nodes... We then moved to the large 11L lymph node

lines.selection_reason: Bundled into surgical bronchoscopy (31653) per NCCI and CPT guidelines.

financial_analysis.mppr_assumptions: Single primary procedure; no MPPR reduction applied.
financial_analysis.notes: Values are unadjusted 2025 Medicare national averages.

per_code.summary: Primary EBUS-TBNA code for sampling 3 or more stations. Documentation confirms sampling of 11R, 7, 4R, 2R, and 11L (5 stations total).
Dropped as bundled service. Diagnostic bronchoscopy is inherent to surgical bronchoscopy (31653) performed in the same session.

rules_applied.description: Diagnostic bronchoscopy bundled with surgical bronchoscopy

global_comments: Procedure performed under General Anesthesia; moderate sedation codes (99152/99153) are not applicable.
